docs.title: MkDocs Demo
docs.text:
This repo provides an example of a MkDocs website using the Material for MkDocs theme. Details are included for hosting the website for a Github Project, User or Organization.

Note

This is intended to be more of a template than a tutorial.

Helpful Links

  • MkDocs
  • Material for MkDocs
  • Material for MkDocs Extensions
  • Markdown Cheatsheet
  • Github User, Organization, and Project Pages
  • MkDocs Demo Github Repo

docs.title: MkDocs Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site
  • mkdocs help - Print this help message

The Makefile in this repo provides make targets for these comands.

docs.title: CNAME file
docs.text:
• The CNAME file contains the custom domain name, e.g., www.mkdocs-demo.org
  • Do not include a CNAME file in the repo if you are not using a custom domain name, i.e., you are using the default URL

docs.title: MkDocs Project Layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml                     # Configuration file
.gitignore                     # exclude site/ 
docs/
    CNAME                      # Optional custom domain name
    assets/images/favicon.ico  # favicon file
    images/owls.png            # logo file
    index.md                   # Website homepage
    ...                        # Markdown pages, images and other files
site/                          # Generated website (not included in repo)

docs.title: Github User and Organization Websites
docs.text:
Github User and Organization websites are described here

User and Organization Details

  • MkDocs content is kept in org-name-mkdocs repo

docs.title: Website Deployment
docs.text:
• User and Organization websites use two repos: one for the MkDocs content and the other for the website output, e.g., org-name-mkdocs and org-name.github.io
  • The site is built with: 
    cd ../org-name.github.io; mkdocs gh-deploy --config-file ../org-name-mkdocs/mkdocs.yml --remote-branch master
  • The site content is pushed to the org-name.github.io repo's master branch
  • The Makefile in this repo has a target for building the site

MkDocs Description

Deploying Organization and User Pages

docs.title: Default URL
docs.text:
• The default URL for an User website is: https://user-name.github.io/user-name.github.io
  • The default URL for an Organization website is: https://org-name.github.io/org-name.github.io, e.g., https://athenian-robotics.github.io/athenian-robotics.github.io/

docs.text:

Project Details

An empty .nojekyll file is required in the root

docs.title: Website Deployment
docs.text:
• The site is built with: mkdocs gh-deploy
  • The site's content is pushed to the Project repo's gh_pages branch
  • The Makefile in this repo has a target for building the site

docs.text: • The default URL for a Project website is: https://project-name.github.io/project-name, e.g., https://athenian-programming.github.io/mkdocs-demo/
